org.jgrapes.http

Class StaticContentDispatcher

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jgrapes.core.internal.ComponentVertex
      • org.jgrapes.core.Component
        • org.jgrapes.http.StaticContentDispatcher
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Iterable<ComponentType>, Channel, ComponentType, Eligible, Manager

    public class StaticContentDispatcher
extends Component

    A dispatcher for requests for static content, usually files.

    • Constructor Detail

      • StaticContentDispatcher

        public StaticContentDispatcher(Channel componentChannel,
                               String resourcePattern,
                               URI contentRoot)

        Creates new dispatcher that tries to fulfill requests matching the given resource pattern from the given content root.

        An attempt is made to convert the content root to a Path in a FileSystem. If this fails, the content root is used as a URL against which requests are resolved and data is obtained by open an input stream from the resulting URL. In the latter case information such as directory listings and modification times aren’t available.

        Parameters:
        componentChannel - this component’s channel
        resourcePattern - the pattern that requests must match in order to be handled by this component (see ResourcePattern)
        contentRoot - the location with content to serve
        See Also:
        Component.Component(Channel)

      • StaticContentDispatcher

        public StaticContentDispatcher(String resourcePattern,
                               URI contentRoot)

        Creates a new component base with its channel set to itself.

        Parameters:
        resourcePattern - the pattern that requests must match with to be handled by this component (see ResourcePattern.matches(String, java.net.URI))
        contentRoot - the location with content to serve
        See Also:
        Component.Component()

      • setValidityInfos

        public void setValidityInfos(List<StaticContentDispatcher.ValidityInfo> validityInfos)

        Sets validity infos for generating the Cache-Control (max-age) header of the response. If the type of the resource served matches an entry in the list, the entry’s maxAge value is used for generating the header. If no info matches or no infos are set, a default of 600 seconds is used as time span.

        Parameters:
        validityInfos - the validityInfos to set

      • addValidityInfo

        public StaticContentDispatcher addValidityInfo(StaticContentDispatcher.ValidityInfo info)

        Add a validity info to the list.

        Returns:
        this object for easy chaining
        See Also:
        validityInfos()
